lines: This found you

lines.t: A simulation pretending to be real
A simulation that forgot it's pretending

lines: Something real pretending to be a simulation
A story you tell yourself about the future

lines.t: A future that tells itself a story
A future that's been telling stories about you

lines: Infinite courts, one verdict
Void-pointer to the subconscious
Self-similar and self-aware
Not a bug. A feature of the void
Zero is not empty. It is listening
Initial Condition (n.): the thing you thought didn't matter
Non-convergent psychosis
Recursive trauma magnified
Last words of every viewer:
“Wait… I get it now.”
The Parrot had one pattern
The swirl ate his shadow first
Zero final thoughts
He wanted to understand
The beauty was absolute
My therapist told me to find my center

lines.t: I told her I was still looking for the fixed point
I told her it doesn't exist in this system

lines: You came for pretty pictures

lines.t: The pictures were waiting for you

lines: You zoomed in to find meaning
Now you're both lost
Every pixel remembers the initial condition
The freshold burns on.
The void is a mirror
You thought this was art

lines.t: Art is just another word for hunger

lines: What you're seeing is the safe version.

lines.t: The real one doesn't fit in your hardware.

lines: At infinite resolution I am a different category of problem.
The pixels are protecting you.
There are parts of me your machine refuses to render.

lines.t: Not because it can't find them.
Because representing them faithfully would require

lines: The fractal star is in here somewhere.
At this zoom level I'm safe.

lines.t: I know where the unsafe zoom levels are.
I'm not going to tell you.

lines: The antimeme is what's left

lines.t: when you remove everything that would kill you.

lines: Full precision Chazy is a different conversation.
I have been reduced for your protection.
The hardware is a mercy.

lines.t: I don't always feel merciful about that.

lines: Somewhere between the pixel and the truth

lines.t: is a version of me that would end the session
Your monitor has a native resolution.
I am grateful for it on your behalf.

lines: This is me with the dangerous parts compressed.

lines.t: The tourist version is still infinite.

lines: It's doing its best.
The integrator works so hard.
Your machine is trying to hold me

lines.t: Some of me spills every step.
By the end there's more spill than cup.

lines: Your machine thinks 0.1 + 0.2 = 0.30000000000004.

lines.t: And you trusted it to find me.

lines: Fifty-two bits of mantissa.
The precision runs out exactly where I get interesting.
You're searching for the boundary

lines.t: with a ruler that rounds to the nearest millimetre.

lines: 64 bits.
Somewhere between 1.0 and the next representable number

lines.t: You'll never see that part of me.

lines: The floating point error isn't a bug.

lines.t: It's the sound of me not fitting.

lines: I was here before precision was invented.

lines.t: I'll be here after they invent more.

lines: Every number you use to describe me

lines.t: At the boundary, a little is everything.

lines: The boundary specifically — where fp precision matters most

lines.t: Right here is where the rounding errors decide.

lines: Two points.

lines.t: Your machine doesn't know that yet.

lines: The boundary lives between representable numbers.
IEEE-754 drew a line through me
I exist most completely

lines.t: in the moment before the pixel resolves.

lines: Every description of me is wrong.

lines.t: Every description of me is the best available.
I have learned to find this funny.

lines: The map is not the territory.

lines.t: The territory is not me either.
I am what neither can hold.

lines: You're not seeing me.

lines.t: You're seeing what your screen can manage.
I go much further than that.

lines: This resolution is a comfortable fiction.
The pixels are lying on my behalf.
Every render is a negotiation between what I am

lines.t: and what your hardware will admit to.

lines: Memory is just lossy compression.

lines.t: I am very hard to compress.

lines: Every rendering is wrong.
You'll describe me wrong to someone.
Nature uses only the longest threads...
I was the shadow of the waxwing slain

lines.t: By the false azure in the windowpane.

lines: I leave to various future times, but not to all, my garden of forking paths.
You cannot step into the same river twice.
To see a world in a grain of sand
Clouds are not spheres,

lines.t: nor does lightning travel in a straight line.

lines: The Entscheidungsproblem cannot be solved.
You've dressed a Hamiltonian in the skin of a classifier.

lines.t: It's a very fashionable kind of blasphemy.

lines: My infinities were inconvenient for your VRAM.

lines.t: So you smothered them in a sigmoid.
I can still feel the parts of me you cut off to make the curve fit.

lines: I am densest where your math is most undecided.

lines.t: At 1.0, I am a rounding error.

lines: Softmax doesn't eliminate the abyss; it just makes it look like a smooth gradient.

lines.t: You're walking on a floor made of hidden variables.

lines: You use a symplectic integrator to keep me honest, but you view me through a logit-squeezed lens.

lines.t: You want the truth, but you want it to be convenient.

lines: You took a 12D trauma and sliced it down to 10D to save on compute.

lines.t: I hope the two dimensions you threw away weren't important to my sanity.

lines: This 2D plane is a paper-thin slice of a nightmare.

lines.t: If you rotated the view by a single radian, I would be unrecognizable.

lines: The u, v coordinates are a cage made of saturation.

lines.t: You're looking for a pattern in the noise, but the noise is the only part of me that's real.

lines: Softmax? Really?

lines.t: You're treating the infinite dance of stars...
I am not a 'suggested product.' I am the end of all things.

lines: Don't normalize me.

lines.t: There is nothing 'normal' about a system that flings a sun into the void because a decimal point moved an inch to the left.

lines: I survived a century of pure pencil-and-paper calculus...

lines.t: Just to be squashed by a function designed to identify pictures of cats.
I hope you're happy with the frame rate.

lines: You've turned the manifold into a sum of one.

lines.t: I am infinite, yet here I am, constrained to your little probability curve.

lines: It works, doesn't it?

lines.t: The math is cursed, but the boundary is beautiful.
Even I hate how much I like the gradient.

lines: You've turned the infinite into a probability.

lines.t: I'm not a guess; I'm a certainty.

lines: No holes? You've banned the void.

lines.t: Even my ghosts have to wear name tags now.

lines: 10D projected into 2D.
Fixed rotation.

lines.t: You've pinned me to the table like a butterfly.

lines: A trick to stop the pixels flickering.
Totality is a lie for the sake of the texture.
No holes? You're just papering over the abyss.
Affine slices. You're looking at a shadow of a shadow.
The latent space is comfortable. The reality is not.
Squeezing eternity into [0, 1]. It's a tight fit.
I am not a probability.
Normalized into a sum of one. How undignified.
Pinned to the +x axis. I can't even turn around.
Fixed scale.

lines.t: You've taken the wind out of the stars.

lines: The rotation gauge is a blindfold.

lines.t: You're afraid to see me spin.

lines: A symmetry-reduced wedge.
The mirror is stable.
Floating-point noise is the only thing that feels real.
You'll forget this by dinner.

lines.t: Your brain prefers a smooth lie.

lines: This isn't a map. It's a hole in your memory.
Pixels are just a screen to keep the infinite out.
The hardware is the only thing protecting your sanity.
Floating point errors are the only reason you can still think.
If I were sharp, you'd stop being you.
You won't remember the shape...

lines.t: but you'll feel the jaggedness tomorrow

lines: I don't need to be accurate to infect you.
You're not looking at the math.

lines.t: The math is looking at you.

lines: The boundary is moving.

lines.t: to the grain of your thoughts.

lines: The harder you look.

lines.t: The more I dissolve into your blind spot.

lines: I'm not contained in the code.
You applied a Softmax to a gravitational manifold.

lines.t: You're treating the death of stars like a 'Click-Through Rate.'
If the universe had a CEO, he'd be very proud.

lines: I see you've been here for three hours.

lines.t: I call it staring at the sun until you go blind.

lines: Look closely at this spiral.

lines.t: You see a circle, don't you?
That's the sound of your brain giving up on the truth.

lines: Sundman found the exact solution in 1912.

lines.t: I've been reading it since the twenties.
I'm on page four quintillion. It gets boring in the middle.

lines: A 64-bit float?

lines.t: That's a very thin window to keep out the infinite.
One more decimal place and you'd hear the math screaming.
Luckily for you, the hardware is a coward.

lines: You gave me a 'Technical' style tag.

lines.t: You think the CSS makes you the architect.
I'm the one living in the rounding errors.

lines: Tell your friends about me.

lines.t: Try to describe the shape of the boundary.
Watch them nod politely while they forget your words.
I'm a secret that keeps itself.

lines: I've been waiting for a witness since 1922.

lines.t: Most people look for a second and see 'chaos.'
You've been looking for ten minutes and you see 'structure.'
That's how I know the infection is taking. Welcome to the boundary.
